questions.text: A 20-month-old male infant presented with developmental delay, seizures, and eczema. His urine has a characteristic tom cat urine smell, and blood analysis indicated organic acidemia. The patient is advised to take biotin supplementation to treat which of the following condition?

A 25-year-old male presents to the dermatologic clinic to evaluate his skin lesions. His medical history is consistent with atopic asthma and neurofibromatosis 1. On examination, the following spots in the axillary region of the patient are seen: Which of the following sign best describe the above-mentioned skin lesions?

A 40-year-old man comes to the clinic complaining of difficulty swallowing and heartburn for 1 year. He also complains of progressively worsening difficulty swallowing liquids and solids; sometimes, the food is regurgitated. An upper GI endoscopy is done, which shows dilated oesophagus body and no peristalsis. Consequently, a barium swallow is done, and the result is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male presents to the emergency department with seizures associated with high-grade fever for the last ten days . The patient is a known case of diabetes mellitus type 2. On examination, the patient appears confused and disoriented to time and place . There is no history of trauma . The contrast-enhanced computed tomography of the brain, showed a walled, well-defined, ring-enhancing mass.. Which of the following statements is true regarding central nervous system infections ?

options.label: A
options.text: Cranial osteomyelitis most frequently arises from the spread of bacteria through the bloodstream

options.label: B
options.text: Subdural empyema is ordinarily treated by administration of antibiotics without the need for surgical drainage

options.label: C
options.text: Most common site of brain abscess due to hematogenous spread is the temporal lobe.

options.label: D
options.text: A bacterial brain abscess is accompanied by systemic signs of infection, such as fever or leukocytosis

questions.correct_answer: D. A bacterial brain abscess is accompanied by systemic signs of infection, such as fever or leukocytosis

questions.text: Allowing equal interview time to cases and controls can reduce which of the following bias?

A previously healthy 65-year-old lady is hospitalized for the treatment of cervical spondylosis. The laboratory work-up shows her serum calcium level of 12.5mg/dl . Her past medical history is unremarkable. Her only medications are a daily multivitamin and acetaminophen , which she took daily for hip pain two months ago. Vital signs are within normal limits. She seems a bit confused but oriented in time, place, and person. Laboratory studies show a haemoglobin concentration of 13.1 g/dl, a serum creatinine concentration of 1.2 mg/dl, and serum phosphate of 2.2mg/dl . Which is the first investigation to be ordered on this patient?

A 27-year-old male is brought to the emergency department due to sudden loss of consciousness for about 45 minutes. He has a similar history of episodes of lightheadedness associated with diaphoresis, palpitation, tremulousness, and feeling of impending doom in the past, off and on for the last 3 years, which were relieved by eating something or taking glucose water orally. He has no other significant medical history. However, his father was diagnosed with a pituitary tumour some years back. Initial investigations are done. The physician suspects this is a case of insulinoma. Which of the following is the most sensitive imaging modality of choice for this diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Computed tomography scan of the abdomen

questions.text: A community medicine intern during his viva was asked about the criteria of At Risk infants. All of the following are the criteria for identifying ‘At Risk’ infants, except?
questions.correct_answer: A. Birth weight less than 2.8 kg

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman, Gravida 2 Para 1, at 15 weeks of gestation, presents to the obstetric outpatient department for her antenatal visit. She has a history of frequent episodes of Generalised tonic-clonic seizures for 8 years and is currently on maintenance with antiepileptic drugs . She is currently concerned if she can continue the same pharmacotherapy for her seizures throughout her pregnancy. Based on the patient’s history, which of the following antiepileptics is the safest for Generalised tonic-clonic seizures?

A 33-yr-old male presented to your clinic with numbness from the lower trunk to the distal lower extremities, anteriorly and posteriorly, bilaterally equal. On examination, reflexes were hyperactive, and hypoesthesia was present with the neurological pinwheel exam. Initial investigations were done. A probable diagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis was made. Which of the following tests is not useful for evaluating the above diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a chest x-ray finding in a case of Staphylococcus pneumonia?

A 66-year-old male who had recently undergone surgery for gastric cancer presents to the emergency department with complaints of dyspnoea and mental changes that occurred two hours prior presentation. The patient's oxygen saturation in room air was 88% , and it is increased to 94% after supplementation with an oxygen mask . His blood pressure is 120/80 mmHg, and his body temperature is 37.8°C. His family claims that there is no history of trauma or chronic respiratory disease. If this is a case of air embolism, what will be your next step in the investigation?

A 26-year-old male presents to the clinic with a complaint of headache and sometimes blurry vision. He also had one episode of passing out. MRI is done, which is suggestive of medulloblastoma. A biopsy is performed to confirm the diagnosis. Which of the following are histological features of medulloblastoma, as shown in the diagram?

options.label: B
options.text: Normal amount of cytoplasm and normochromatic nuclei

questions.text: A 36-year-old male worker visits the clinic complaining of lesions affecting his groin region for the last five days. He has been diagnosed with atopic dermatitis since childhood and has used topical corticosteroids frequently for its management. On examination, annular, scaly diffuse plaques are found in the groin. Which of the following is the most likely working diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Aspect Description
Definition Fungal skin infection (usually dermatophyte)
Tinea Incognito Term used when fungal infection is altered by treatment
  with corticosteroids or other immunosuppressive agents
Cause Dermatophyte fungi, often Trichophyton or Epidermophyton
Presentation Altered appearance due to use of topical steroids
  Rash becomes less red, less scaly, more diffuse
Misdiagnosis Risk Often misdiagnosed as eczema, psoriasis, or other rash
Common Sites Areas prone to fungal infections (groin, face, hands)
  Typically in regions where corticosteroids are used
Diagnosis Clinical examination, history of steroid use
  May require skin scraping for microscopic examination
Treatment Identify and discontinue corticosteroids
  Treat with antifungal medication (oral/topical)
Prevention Proper diagnosis before steroid application
  Educating patients about appropriate steroid use
Complications Chronic and more resistant fungal infection
  Delayed proper treatment and worsening of symptoms

questions.text: A 67-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a four-week history of fatigue, weight loss, fever and night sweats. He has also noticed multiple painless lumps in his neck and axilla that have increased in size since he first noticed them 4 weeks ago. His medical history includes hypertension and diabetes, which are well-controlled with medication. On physical examination re numerous enlarged cervical and supraclavicular lymph nodes are seen. Biopsy shows lymphocytes that stain positive for CD20. Genetic analysis reveals a BCL6 mutation on chromosome 3. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents to the physician with the complaint of a painless area of induration on the lower limbs. It is reported that it began as a firm, painless nodule in the skin several weeks ago. Examination reveals a necrotic ulcer with undermined edges on lower limbs, extending to deeper tissues destroying nerves, blood vessels, and muscles. A direct smear is taken from the necrotic base of the ulcer and stained with Ziehl-Neelsen stain to reveal clumps of acid-fast bacilli under a microscope. A skin test with burulin gives a positive response. This type of ulcer is caused by?

A 48- year-old male presents to OPD with severe pain in his big toe, with multiple such episodes for the past 5 years . He has taken certain painkillers. He has been hypertensive for the last 3 years. He has been diagnosed with chronic kidney disease for the past 6 months . His lab investigations reveal hyperkalemia, metabolic acidosis, hyperuricemia, and raised creatinine. Which of the following drugs is the best for treating the given condition?

A 1 st -year resident is explaining the anatomy and physiology of ureters. He mentions that the ureters pass obliquely through the bladder wall. Although there are no ureteral sphincters, the oblique passage tends to keep the ureters closed except during peristaltic waves, preventing urine reflux from the bladder. Ureteric peristalsis is triggered by?

options.label: D
options.text: Pacemaker activity of the smooth muscle cells in the renal pelvis

questions.correct_answer: D. Pacemaker activity of the smooth muscle cells in the renal pelvis

questions.text: After family planning education in a rural PHC, a 29-year-old female presented to the hospital for sterilization, all of the following are the Guidelines for Sterilization except?

options.label: A
options.text: The age of the husband should not ordinarily be less than 25 years, nor should it be over 50 years

options.label: B
options.text: The age of the wife should not be less than 22 years or more than 45 years

options.label: C
options.text: The motivated couple must have 3 living children at the time of operation

options.label: D
options.text: If the couple has 3 or more living children, the lower limit of the age of the husband or wife may be relaxed at the discretion of the operating surgeon

questions.correct_answer: C. The motivated couple must have 3 living children at the time of operation

questions.text: A 20-year-old girl comes to the orthopaedic OPD complaining of painful swelling above the left knee joint. The swelling was initially small but increased rapidly to a large size. Her family and past medical history are unremarkable. She also has a history of weight loss and anorexia. On local examination, there is an ill-defined diffuse swelling extending from the lower pole of the patella to the supracondylar region of the femur. An X-ray is performed, and the image is shown below. What is the probable diagnosis in this case?
Which compensatory changes occur when a person moves from a supine position to a standing position ?

A 30-year-old man presents to the emergency department with complaints of difficulty breathing, sweating, racing heart, and nausea for the last 30 minutes. He has a history of panic disorder in the past. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 104/min, and blood pressure is 110/80 mm Hg. Arterial blood gases of the patient show the following results: pH= 7.52 PaCO2= 20 mmHg HCO3 - = 22 mEq/L Which of the following condition would be found in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: He has decreased ionized Ca +2 in the blood

options.label: C
options.text: He has decreased total Ca +2 in the blood

options.label: D
options.text: He has an acid-base disorder caused by the overproduction of fixed acid

questions.correct_answer: B. He has decreased ionized Ca +2 in the blood

questions.text: The synaptic connection with the next neuron for a sensory nerve fibre connected to a Pacinian corpuscle located on the palmar surface of the right hand in the corresponding sensory pathway is located in which of the following locations?

options.label: C
options.text: The dorsal horn of the right side of the spinal cord

options.label: D
options.text: The dorsal horn of the left side of the spinal cord

questions.correct_answer: C. The dorsal horn of the right side of the spinal cord

questions.text: A 28-year-old primigravida at 33 weeks of gestation presents to the antenatal clinic with complaints of headache, oliguria, and blurred vision for 1 day . Her BP comes out to be 180/110mmHg. Her urinalysis is positive for protein (+3) . Which of the following is the immediate next step in management for this patient?

A middle-aged male presented with a history of 2 episodes of hematemesis over 48 hours is diagnosed as a case of upper GI bleeding. Which of the following is helpful as a prognostic scale in such patients?

A 55-year-old male patient presented in the Emergency with weakness, nausea and vomiting. On examination, there was jaundice, reduced alertness and poor concentration, progressing through behavioural abnormalities, such as restlessness and aggressive outbursts. He was found to have Ascites and hepatic failure on further workup. He stated that he had taken alcohol every day for the last 20 years. Which one of the following is NOT true about the Ascitic fluid on paracentesis?

options.label: A
options.text: SAAG> 1.1 is seen with portal hypertension

options.label: B
options.text: SAAG < 1.1 is seen with Nephrotic syndrome

options.label: C

questions.text: A 44-year-old male with a gunshot wound to the abdomen presents with hypotension, tachycardia, and signs of peritonitis. Upon transfer to the operating room for urgent surgery, the anesthetist administers a drug that inhibits excitatory NMDA receptors. What is the likely drug used?
Which of the following drugs is not generally used for long-term therapy in Heart Failure with reduced Ejection Fraction (HFrEF )?

A 28-year-old man presented to the hospital complaining of intractable vomiting and inability to eat or drink for the past 3 days. His blood analysis still shows a normal glucose level. Which of the following processes is mainly responsible for the blood glucose maintenance in this patient?
Which is the common amino acid between the urea cycle and TCA ?

A 25 year old male returning from South America to India was kept in quarantine by the airport authorities. Due to recent advances in Health care system, quarantine has been replaced nowadays by which of the following?

questions.text: Fish and Shellfish concentrate this element in their bodies, often in the form of a highly toxic organic compound. Bioaccumulation in seafood carries over into human populations, where it can result in poisoning which causes severe neurological and kidney damage. Acute exposure can affect the respiratory and gastrointestinal systems. In its organic form, it can cross the blood-brain barrier and cause irreversible nervous system and brain damage which is collectively termed as "Swift Feer disease". Poisoning with which element is being described here?

Vani, a 30 year old female, had persistent feelings of anxiety and worry associated with insomnia, irritability, tension, and fatigue. Over the years, her friends and family rebuked her for "worrying too much," and she reported difficulty controlling her anxiety over her financial situation, job security, and her children's safety, despite evidence that none of these were problematic. Her husband reported that he found her persistent anxiety and ongoing need for reassurance "exhausting" and that he noticed himself withdrawing from her, which led to significant tension between them. Drug of choice for this disorder is:

A 27-year-old male presents with recurrent history of tonsillitis. This year he had 5 attacks of acute tonsillitis, which were managed without complications. He is admitted for elective tonsillectomy under general anaesthesia. His past history is significant for fracture of the humerus following an RTA for which he underwent repair and internal fixation under general anaesthesia. He is concerned about postoperative nausea and vomiting, which he suffered following previous surgery. What would be the ideal anaesthetic agent in this case?

A 45-year-old male is undergoing superficial parotidectomy under general anaesthesia to manage pleomorphic adenoma of the parotid. Induction is done with Inj. Thiopentone sodium and cisatracurium are used to facilitate endotracheal intubation and maintenance. Which end-point is used as an indicator to obtain recovery from the neuromuscular blocker?

questions.text: All of the following are true about the parathyroid gland except ?

options.label: C

questions.text: A three years old male child presented with mild pallor, icterus, and a history of on and off abdominal and joint pains. On examination, the child had mild splenomegaly. He had a history of two prior hospital admissions. He has had three transfusions till now; the last transfusion was 3 months back. There is a history of sibling death due to fever and jaundice at 5 years of age. The hemogram showed anaemia with leukocytosis. The peripheral smear is done, and images are shown below. Which of the following is true about the finding?

options.label: A
options.text: It occurs equally in both heterozygous and homozy­gous variants

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated with reduced MCHC

questions.correct_answer: C. It is reversible with oxygenation

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy born to a primigravida mother presented with hoarseness. On laryngeal examination, findings are seen as shown in the image below. Which of the following statements is not true about the given condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Caused by Human Papilloma Virus 16 and 18

options.label: B
options.text: Surgical Excision by Microdebrider is the treatment of choice

options.label: C
options.text: Interferon- α is used as adjuvant therapy to decrease recurrence

options.label: D
options.text: Radiotherapy is contraindicated as it may cause malignant transformation

questions.correct_answer: A. Caused by Human Papilloma Virus 16 and 18

questions.text: A 37-year-old female presents to the ENT department with a hoarse voice for the past few days . She also has occasional gastric reflux symptoms and a constant desire to clear her throat. On laryngoscopy following finding is seen: Which of the following is incorrect regarding her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Unilateral & over the vocal process of arytenoids

options.label: C
options.text: Speech therapy to correct the pitch of voice

options.label: D
options.text: Intralesional injection of steroid is given to correct inflammation and size of granuloma

questions.correct_answer: B. Throat pain improves on phonation

questions.text: A 20-year-old girl presents to the clinic due to a sore throat for 4 days. It is associated with low-grade fever and generalized abdominal pain. On physical examination, there are enlarged right cervical lymph nodes and enlarged tonsils with a membrane over them. She has been prescribed an antibiotic course for 7 days. She returns to the clinic on the 9ᵗʰ day as the symptoms persist after the treatment. Which of the following is the specific test for this patient’s diagnosis?

A 5-year-old male presents to the clinic for a follow-up appointment. He was recently operated on for deviated nasal septum and turbinate hypertrophy. After a thorough history and examination, the following test was performed. Which of the following statement is false regarding the test?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a cold spatula test.

options.label: B
options.text: Gives information about the patency of the nasal cavity

options.label: C
options.text: Test showing reduced fogging on any side implies nasal obstruction

options.label: D
options.text: Physiologically superior to the cotton wool wisp test.

questions.correct_answer: D. Physiologically superior to the cotton wool wisp test.

questions.text: A 21-year-old man presents in the outpatient department after extreme bilateral nasal obstruction and pain in his nose. He also has been experiencing a fever with chills after septal surgery. He developed a furuncle over his upper lip 3 days ago. An anterior rhinoscopy shows a smooth, fluctuant swelling on both sides of the septum. Which of the following is most likely the diagnosis?

A 30-year-old lady claims the tree trunk outside her flat resembles Lord Ram's face. She can always see Lord Ram's face when she walks past that tree, but not on the other trees. The person's behavior is described by which one of the following terms?
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ It is a false and firm belief that irrelevant occurrences or details in the world relate directly to oneself.
  • ↳ It is a false and firm belief that irrelevant occurrences or details in the world relate directly to oneself.
  • ↳ Option D: Visual hallucination
  • ↳ Visual hallucination refers to the false perception in the absence of any stimulus or object. It is as vivid as a real perception. They occur in outer and objective space. They are not under voluntary, willful control. Visual hallucinations are commonly seen in Organic mental disorders.
  • ↳ Visual hallucination refers to the false perception in the absence of any stimulus or object.
  • ↳ It is as vivid as a real perception.
  • ↳ They occur in outer and objective space.
  • ↳ They are not under voluntary, willful control.
  • ↳ Visual hallucinations are commonly seen in Organic mental disorders.
    • References:

    • ↳ Illusion is the false perception of a real object or stimulus.
    • ↳ Illusion is a disorder of perception.
    • ↳ Delusional misidentification syndromes are a group of delusional phenomena in which patients misidentify familiar persons, objects, or self and believe that they have been replaced or transformed.
    • ↳ Delusion of reference is a false and firm belief that irrelevant occurrences or details in the world relate directly to oneself.
    • ↳ Visual hallucination refers to the false perception in the absence of any stimulus or object.

questions.explanation:
Entry wound Exit wound
Skull Outer table Clean cut hole Bevelled opening

questions.text: Under which section, if a witness is forced to give an answer admitting his guilt, he cannot be arrested or prosecuted for it and it is also not taken as proof against him in any criminal proceeding?

A 3-year-old female patient is brought to the clinic by her foster care parents. She was adopted from Iran, and according to her records, she was born to a mother who suffered from alcohol abuse. Referring to the image given below, what is the most probable diagnosis?

The next morning, he had normal serum thiamine with blood glucose = 73 mg/dL . Which of the following enzymes/proteins would have low significant physiologic activity in this patient soon after discharge?

A 4 - year - old child is brought to the hospital with easy fatigability and a history of recurrent pneumonia . The patient was born full-term via normal vaginal delivery, and there was no known history of cyanosis or jaundice in the neonatal period. He has met all the developmental milestones. He is up to date with his current vaccination. On examination, his temperature is 37.2 (98.9F), blood pressure is 100/80 mm Hg, heart rate is 102/min, and respiratory rate is 20/min. Pulse oximetry shows an oxygen saturation of 95%. Cardiac examination reveals fixed splitting of S2 heart sound, and a murmur is heard at the left upper sternal border . Chest auscultation reveals crackles more pronounced at the middle lobe of the right lung. Upon further evaluation, the patient has been diagnosed with septum primum type of ASD. W hich of the following heart chamber overburden s in this condition?

options.label: B
options.text: L eft atrium plus left ventricle

options.label: C
options.text: R ight atrium plus left atrium

questions.text: Which calcium channel blocker with peripheral action would be prescribed for a 55-year-old male presenting with mild headache and dizziness, having a blood pressure of 140/90 mmHg and a pulse rate of 90 beats per minute , and already on once-daily dosing?

A 49-year-old known diabetic has had symptoms of mild hematuria , itching of the skin , decreased appetite, difficulty in breathing after walking for 25 meters and fatigue for about 6 months duration. On examination, peri-orbital edema is noted, a panel of tests is ordered, and it confirms chronic renal failure . If a diuretic needs to be administered to the patient, which of the following options is suitable?

Which of the following is the drug of choice for patients with cerebral malaria ?

questions.text: A 2-year-old girl who emigrated from Pakistan 2 weeks ago is brought to the emergency department because of a 1-day history of progressive weakness of her left leg. One week ago, she had a 3-day episode of flu-like symptoms that resolved without treatment. The patient has not yet received any routine childhood vaccinations. Deep tendon reflexes are 1+ in the right lower extremity and absent in the left lower extremity. Vaccination is integral for kids. Concerning vaccination, what is the principle on which vaccination is based?
questions.explanation:
Active immunity Passive immunity
1. Produced actively by the host's immune system No active host participation; received passively.
2. Antibodies induced by infection or by immunogens (vaccination) Induced by ready-made antibody transferred
3. Long-lasting Short time
4. Lag period present, immunity effective only after lag period Immediate immunity; no lag period
5. Immunological memory present No immunological memory
6. Booster doses-useful on subsequent dose Subsequent doses-less effective due to immune elimination
7. The negative phase may occur. No negative phase
8. In Immunodeficiency- not useful Applicable even in immunodeficient persons.
9. Active immunity often involves both cell-mediated and humoral immunity. Passive immunity is due to ready-made antibodies.

10.

Types:

Natural—clinical or inapparent infection;

Artificial— induced by vaccines.

Types:

Natural—transfer of maternal antibodies through the placenta;

Artificial—injection of immunoglobulins.
11. Durable; effective protection Transient; less effective

Succinylcholine. Ether is used as an inhalational agent during the intraoperative period. Which of the following would be least likely to be observed in this patient with ether anaesthesia?

questions.text: A 28-year-old G2P1L1 female presents to the obstetrics outpatient department with a positive Indirect Coombs test with high titers. The mother is Rh negative, and the father is Rh positive. The physician is planning for umbilical blood sampling to detect the degree of fetal anemia and to plan further management. Her previous pregnancy had ended in a spontaneous vaginal delivery at term. After all routine investigations and the confirmation of fetal well-being, she is started on oral nifedipine for the arrest of labour. A 72-year-old woman presents to the pulmonology ward with shortness of breath , a productive cough, chest pain, mild fatigue, weight loss, and a history of hypertension . She is a school teacher with a 45 - pack-year smoking history. She is still an active smoker . On physical examination, she has mild dullness on percussion with decreased breath sounds . The chest x-ray shows a left hilar mass and a 5.4 cm left upper lobe mass. A CT scan reveals a hilar mass with bilateral mediastinal extension; no distant metastatic disease is found. Paraneoplastic syndrome

  • Gastrin Releasing peptide
  • AVP

Response to chemotherapy
  • Superior response

questions.text: A 65-year-old Asian woman comes to hospital complaining of occasional night sweats during the past two months. There is a nontender skin lesion near the right large toenail . questions.text: What is the primary action of sulfasalazine when used in the treatment of ulcerative colitis?

A 35-year-old female presents to the Gynaecology clinic with complaints of heavy menstrual cycles for the last 4 years. She does not wish to take injections or daily tablets. She insists on a hysterectomy. Which of the following statements is irrelevant regarding the use of this device?

options.label: A
options.text: Use as a contraceptive is associated with an increased incidence of menorrhagia

options.label: C
options.text: Not suitable for women with a history of hormonal imbalances

options.label: D
options.text: Irregular uterine bleeding can be a problem initially.

questions.correct_answer: A. Use as a contraceptive is associated with an increased incidence of menorrhagia
questions.explanation:
Aspect Information
Name Mirena
Type Intrauterine Device (IUD)
Hormonal Component Levonorgestrel
Mechanism of Action Thickens cervical mucus, inhibits sperm motility, and reduces endometrial receptivity to prevent pregnancy
Contraceptive Duration Effective for up to 5 years after insertion
Additional Indication Treatment of idiopathic menorrhagia (heavy menstrual bleeding) in women desiring contraception
Insertion Procedure Performed by a trained healthcare provider within the uterine cavity
Local Hormone Release Hormone released directly into the uterus, minimizing systemic side effects
Suitability May not be suitable for women with certain hormonal imbalances or conditions
Side Effects Initial irregular uterine bleeding, spotting, or breakthrough bleeding may occur

questions.text: A 56-year-old male accident victim at the emergency room is in urgent need of blood . Because his red cell and plasma groups do not match, the blood bank is unable to determine his ABO group . The patient's emergency blood transfusion should include the following:

options.label: A
options.text: RBC corresponding to his red cell group and colloids/ crystalloid

options.label: B
options.text: Whole blood corresponding to his plasma group

questions.correct_answer: C. O positive RBC and colloids/crystalloid
questions.explanation:
Selection of blood for emergency transfusion
  • If the patient's blood group is unknown, then Group O Rh+ red blood cells can be transfused in males and old females, and to avoid the risk of Rh+ sensitisation, Group O Rh- red blood cells should be transfused.
  • If the patient's blood group is known, then ideally, corresponding ABO-matched red blood cells should be transfused
  • Whole blood transfusion carries the risk of transfusion reaction because donor plasma contains anti-A or anti-B antibodies, which can react with the recipient's A or B antigens.

options.label: D

A 57-year-old lady presents to the hospital with uncontrolled hypertension for the last 15 years. She was diagnosed with systemic hypertension at 30, initially controlled with amlodipine and hydrochlorothiazide. Her condition progressed, and she was later diagnosed with chronic kidney disease. Which of the following immune and inflammatory mediators is this patient's primary cause of graft rejection ?

A 30-year-old male presents to the physician with complaints of swelling and redness of the skin in the groin area, painless ulcers and constipation for 1 week. He has no history of any chronic illnesses. He is vitally stable, and other general physical examinations reveal no abnormalities. After further investigations, the diagnosis of Lymphogranuloma venereum was made by the physician. Which of the following inclusion bodies are present in the patient's pathology?

A 20-year-old female presents to the physician with complaints of vaginal itching, discharge, and pain during intercourse. She has had 3 different sexual partners over the past 2 years. As part of the workup, the doctor did a wet mount of vaginal secretions that showed flagellated organisms with "twitching motility". Identify the organism
questions.explanation:
Microorganism Trichomonas vaginalis
Classification Protozoan parasite
Infection Trichomoniasis
Transmission Primarily through sexual contact, including vaginal, anal, or oral sex
Clinical Presentation - Vaginal itching- Frothy, malodorous vaginal discharge- Pain during urination and intercourse
Pathogenesis Parasite attaches to vaginal and urethral epithelium, causing inflammation and disrupting vaginal flora
Diagnosis - Microscopic examination: "Twitching motility" of flagellated organisms in wet mount- PCR testing
Complications - Increased risk of HIV transmission- Pregnancy complications (preterm birth, low birth weight)
Treatment Antibiotics, usually metronidazole or tinidazole
Prevention - Safe sexual practices- Treatment of infected individuals and their partners
Epidemiology One of the most common curable sexually transmitted infections (STIs), affecting both men and women
Risk Factors Multiple sexual partners, unprotected sex, history of STIs

questions.text: A 35-year-old male immigrant from rural Brazil presents with a swollen face and extremely poor dental hygiene over the last 06 days. He also reports the loss of an adult tooth, which appears to be the focus of the current infection. On examination, two open ulcers on the outside of the swollen cheek appear to be small yellow ‘‘grains’’ in one of the ulcers. On histopathology, the gram stain shows purple-staining fine filaments. questions.explanation:
Eumycetoma 

Actinomycetoma 

Disease 

 

 

Causative agents 

Fungi 

Bacteria 

Lesion characteristics 

well-encapsulated with a clear margin 

Diffuse with no clear margin 

Sinuses 

Few 

Many 

Colour of grains 

Different colours, but mostly white or black 

Different colours, but not black 

Course of infection 

Slowly progressive 

Inflammatory and rapid progression 

Bone invasion 

After a long time 

Rapid

Small in number, but large in size with clear margins 

Numerous,  small in size (except in case of Actinomadura madurae) with unclear margins 

Management 

 

 

Drug of choice 

Ketoconzaole 

Itraconazole  

 

Dapsone + Streptpmycin 

Rifampicin or sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine 

Amikacin+co-trimoxazole 

Management of choice 

Both medical and surgical intervention required 

Only medical treatment is sufficient (in some advanced cases in combination with surgery) 

Surgery only 

Might cure small, well-encapsulated lesions up to 90% recurrence in most cases 

Not indicated 

Medical treatment only 

Partial cure or improvement 

Useful in most cases

A 63-years-old woman with a history of essential hypertension went to the emergency room with black, tarry stools . She discovered it two days before her emergency room presentation. Abdominal pain, tiredness, or weight loss were not linked to symptoms. Moreover, no significant risk factors, i.e. smoking, alcohol intake or family history of pancreatic cancer , were reported upon her presentation. The skin was paler as usual but otherwise ordinary. There were no palpable lumps and dark tarry stools on digital rectal examination. An upper endoscopy detected active bleeding stomach varices throughout the operation. CT Abdomen is shown below. The most frequently altered oncogene in this condition/disease is :
questions.explanation:
Multiple genes are somatically mutated or epigenetically silenced in each pancreatic carcinoma
KRAS (chromosome 12p)
  • Most frequently altered oncogene in pancreatic cancer
CDKN2A gene (chromosome 9p)
  • It is the most frequently inactivated tumor suppressor gene in these tumors.
SMAD4 tumor suppressor gene (chromosome 18q)
  • It is inactivated in 55% of pancreatic cancers
  • Inactivation of the TP53 tumor suppressor gene (chromosome 17p) occurs in 70% to 75% of pancreatic cancers.

Health promotion

Specific protection

Early diagnosis and treatment,

Screening programs

questions.text: A 23-year-old boy is diagnosed with meningitis . The chief resident discusses the causes of papilledema with his junior residents . He puts forward the following statements regarding this case: Assertion: Increased intracranial pressure can lead to a choked disc, but it doesn't affect the pituitary gland. options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion and Reason are independently true/correct statements, and the Reason is the correct explanation for Assertion.

options.label: B
options.text: Both Assertion and Reason are independently true/correct statements, but Reason is not the correct explanation for the Assertion.

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true/correct statement, but the Reason is independently a false/incorrect statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false/incorrect statement, but the Reason is independently a true/correct statement

questions.text: Which of the following is the mechanism of resistance in Methicillin Resistant Staphulococcus aureus(MRSA)??

A 52-year-old male presents to the emergency department with complaints of fatigue, shortness of breath, and palpitations . The physician notices a pulsating vessel in the neck (image below). His ECG findings are insignificant. What can be the possible diagnosis for this patient?

A 50-year-old patient develops cardiogenic shock following acute myocardial infarction. His urine output decreases in the next few days . He has increased serum urea and creatinine ; urine analysis reveals no glucose or protein, but numerous hyaline casts are present. After a few days, he develops polyuria and serum creatinine levels fall. Histopathology of renal biopsy in this patient would reveal?
questions.explanation:
Initiation
  • Dominated by the inciting medical, surgical or obstetric event in the ischemic form of AKI
  • The only indication of renal involvement is a slight decline in urine output with a rise in BUN

Maintenance
  • A sustained decrease in urine output to between 40 and 400 ml/day - Oliguria
  • Salt and water overload
  • Hyperkalemia
  • Metabolic acidosis

Recovery
  • A steady increase in urine volume that may reach up to 3L/ day
  • The tubules are still damaged, so large amounts of water, sodium and potassium are lost in the flood of urine

questions.text: A 40-year-old chronic alcoholic presents to the clinic with complaints of a burning sensation and discomfort in both eyes. The boy is having severe pain in and around the right eye. The boy’s mother reported no history of loss of consciousness or vomiting. The patient is otherwise vitally stable. questions.text: A nine-month-old male child is brought by his mother to the OPD with complaints of an empty left scrotum and swelling on the left flank that has been present since birth. An ultrasound of the abdomen was done at another center which reported a hernia on the left side. However, the testis was not seen during the scan. questions.text: A 67-year-old male presents to the physician complaining of fatigue and shortness of breath on exertion for six months with bilateral ankle swelling for a month. Buffalo hump

Square toes
  • Toes appear 'Square because of the confinement of footwear

Stemmer’s sign
  • Skin on the dorsum of the toes cannot be pinched because of subcutaneous fibrosis

questions.text: A 44-year-old man with no known co-morbid fell from his bike and sustained a traumatic brain injury resulting in marked expressive dysphasia . A 36-year-old male comes with a 2-day history of chest pain. The pain has been continuous and does not change with activity. A 25-year-old male IV drug user presents with a 3-week history of worsening lethargy and confusion. On examination, his pulse rate is 130bpm, and his blood pressure is 120/80 mmHg. Cardiovascular examination reveals raised JVP with large v-waves and a loud systolic murmur. A palpable, pulsatile liver is felt when the hepato-jugular reflex is attempted. What type of murmur is most fitting with this patient's presentation?

A 61-year-old female patient presents to your clinic due to sudden episodes of left-sided facial pain for the last two days. She states that the pain feels like a 'sharp stabbing' and is a 9/10 in terms of intensity. The pain lasts about 5-10 seconds and then dissipates rapidly. The pain is often brought on by talking and cold wind. Her past medical history is significant for depression and type 2 D.M. What is the diagnosis?

A thirty years old G2P1L1 female presents to your clinic with the complaint of intermittent jaundice. He says she has had jaundice for the past four years, and it comes and goes on its own. She had episodes of jaundice during each pregnancy, which used to start in the late second trimester. In between pregnancies, there was minimal or no jaundice. Initial investigations show conjugated hyperbilirubinemia. Further investigations reveal that she has an MRP2 transporter defect. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 72-year-old male presented with complaints of progressive cervical lymphadenopathy, night sweats. Initial investigations revealed B cell lymphocytosis. Flow cytometry results showed CD19,CD20,CD21,CD23,CD5 positive. He is also found to have NOTCH1 mutations, del(17)(p13.1). Which of the following transformation is likely to happen in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Chronic lymphocytic lymphoma into diffuse large B cell lymphoma

options.label: B
options.text: Diffuse large B cell lymphoma into chronic lymphocytic lymphoma

options.label: C
options.text: Small cell lymphoma into chronic lymphocytic lymphoma

options.label: D
options.text: Chronic lymphocytic lymphoma into small cell lymphoma

questions.correct_answer: A. Chronic lymphocytic lymphoma into diffuse large B cell lymphoma
questions.explanation:
Richter’s transformation
  • Risk Factors: It is CLL/SLL transformation into an aggressive lymphoma due to:
    • Bulky lymphadenopathy
    • NOTCH1 mutations
    • Del (17)(13.1)
    • specific stereotyped IGVH usage.
    • Most common B cell NHL is: DLBCL
  • Most commonly Diffuse large B-cell Lymphoma
  • ⇓ Richter transformation
  • DLBCL (Diffuse lager B cell Lymphoma) [Aggressive]
  • Clinical signs of Richter’s transformation:
  1. Rapid progression in lymphadenopathy
  2. Fatigue
  3. Night sweats
  4. Fever
  5. Weight loss.
  6. LDH is usually high
  • Treatment:
    • Chemotherapy + immunotherapy
    • Drugs used: Fludarabine, Rituximab

questions.text: An obstetrician instructs her resident to give a PGF2 alpha injection after trying oxytocin, methylergometrine, and misoprostol to manage PPH. After a few minutes of relief, the patient starts to bleed again, so the doctor asks for a repeat dose of PGF2 alpha. A 49-year-old male complains of diplopia, slurred speech, breathing difficulty, eyelid drooping, and fatigue worsening throughout the day for a month. Symptoms improve with rest. Vital signs stable. No other abnormalities on exam. Which agent differentiates current pathology from the cholinergic crisis?
questions.explanation:
Diagnostic Methods/Differentiation

MYASTHENIA GRAVIS

Tensilon Test

- Intravenous Edrophonium (2mg) to check muscle weakness improvement.

- Positive response suggests myasthenia gravis diagnosis.

- Edrophonium enhances muscle receptor expression.
 
 

Proactive Test

- D-tubocurarine as competitive blocker to induce sudden weakness.

- Requires ICU or ventilator support.
 

Anti-NR Antibodies

- Modern approach to myasthenia gravis detection.

Differentiation of Crises

- Myasthenic Crisis: Weakness due to insufficient acetylcholine: Improved by Edrophonium.

- Cholinergic Crisis: Weakness due to excessive acetylcholine and rapid desensitization: Worsened by Edrophonium.
 
 
 

Dosage Adjustment

- ↑ Dose of Pyridostigmine if weakness improves.

- ↓ Dose of Pyridostigmine if weakness worsens.

questions.correct_answer: D. Thelarche, pubarche, peak growth velocity, menarche

questions.text: A woman, 30 years of age P1L1 calls up her gynecologist to inform that she had intercourse the previous night and is doubtful whether the ejaculation was inside or outside the vagina. The couple has been practicing coitus interruptus for purpose of contraception. She does not want pregnancy. She has a strip of MALA d tablets with her and wants to know if she can use it now. The doctor should tell her that she should :

options.label: A
options.text: Take 4 tablets stat and repeat after 12 hours

options.label: B
options.text: Start the strip now and take one tablet each day for 21 days

options.label: D
options.text: Wait for periods and follow up only if she is pregnant

questions.correct_answer: A. Take 4 tablets stat and repeat after 12 hours

questions.text: The professor of oncology instructs the medical residents to check the hematocrit levels regularly for all the patients undergoing chemotherapy with a specific new drug as part of their research. These labs are done to monitor the effect of chemotherapy on bone marrow. The hematocrit test measures the volume percentage of red cells in the blood. Its value varies according to age, sex, race, and lifestyle factors. Men normally tend to have higher levels than females. Which of the following reasons explains this gender variation?

30-year-old patient presented with chief complaints of disturbed night-time sleep,excessive sleep at day time , and is unable to resist sleep attacks at day time he is also having vivid perceptions, usually dream-like, which occur before the onset of sleep and before awakening, These symptoms are due to abnormality in which of the following areas of the brain?

A 55-year-old male presents in the cardiology emergency department with complaints of severe chest pain radiating towards the left arm and exertional dyspnea from the last 4 hours. The attending doctor, after examination, labelled him as a patient of triple vessel disease and advised him to CABG surgery. After surgery, the doctor prescribed him medicine and advised him to use a disinfectant at home for some time. That disinfectant is shown below in the image. What is the disinfectant used to disinfect?

A 32-years-old male is brought to the emergency after a road traffic accident. He is disoriented. His vitals are as follows; SpO2 84% at room air, blood pressure 100/70 mmHg and pulse 61/min. On examination, there is decreased air entry in the right lung. After initial resuscitation, an airway, as shown in the picture, is passed. The advantage of the given below airway device is?

options.label: A
options.text: Prevents fall back of tongue post-extubation, can be used in awake patients

questions.correct_answer: A. Prevents fall back of tongue post-extubation, can be used in awake patients

questions.text: A 24-year-old male presents in the ENT outpatient department with complaints of thin painless fluid discharge from the ears. On physical examination, the patient has a blood pressure of 126/82 mmHg with a pulse of 93/min. A CBC of the patient comes with mild leukocytosis of lymphocytes. On otoscopic examination of the ear, the patient has multiple perforations of the tympanic membrane and failure to respond to antimicrobial treatment. What is the most probable causative organism?

A 17-year-old boy comes to your clinic with complaints of headache and runny nose for the last 4 days. The patient gives a history of worsening symptoms during summer while playing outside. On examination, you found the features depicted below in the image. Which of the following will be the most probable diagnosis?

A 60-years-old male who is a chronic smoker presented with shortness of breath. Underwent initial investigation. A chest X-ray shows diffuse bilateral infiltrates, mainly in the lower lobes and shows mild, localised areas of fibrosis causing a reticular pattern. The patient's histology is given below; which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Idiopathic Interstitial Pneumonias

Common Histopathological Findings

UIP pattern

Presence of Fibroblastic Foci Disrupted underlying lung architecture Patchy fibrosis ± subpleural/paraseptal honeycombing

NSIP (cellular & fibrosing types)

Variable fibroblastic foci presence Temporal homogeneity with uniform and diffuse inflammation Preserved underlying lung architecture

COP

Fibroblastic proliferation across several lobules Presence of polypoid plugs of loose organizing connective tissue (Masson bodies) located in airways and alveoli

RB-ILD

Peribronchiolar/centrilobular pigmented alveolar macrophages

DIP

Uniformly and diffusely distributed airspaces filled by pigmented alveolar macrophages

AIP

Uniformly distributed Diffuse Alveolar Damage (DAD) that can be seen in either the exudative, organizing/proliferative or fibrotic phase of injury.

LIP

Uniformly distributed stromal infiltration by lymphoid cells, along with infiltration of the alveolar septa

questions.text: A 60 -years-old male presented to the medicine OPD with the gradual onset of a nonproductive cough and progressive dyspnea . On examination, crackles are heard during inspiration. X-RAY findings are subpleural, and bibasilar fibrosis and reticular abnormalities are seen. The histologic image is given below. Which of the following is true about idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Females are affected more than males

options.label: C
options.text: Nintedanib and Pirfenidone drugs approved for use in IPF

questions.correct_answer: C. Nintedanib and Pirfenidone drugs approved for use in IPF

questions.text: Which of the following laboratory findings are most likely, if a child has a disorder of fatty acid oxidation?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypoglycemia, acidosis, and elevated urine dicarboxylic acids

options.label: B
options.text: Acidosis and elevated urine reducing substances

options.label: C
options.text: Hypoglycemia, acidosis, and elevated serum leucine, isoleucine, and valine

options.label: E
options.text: Hepatomegaly, elevated serum liver enzymes, and elevated tyrosine

questions.correct_answer: A. Hypoglycemia, acidosis, and elevated urine dicarboxylic acids

questions.text: A PhD researcher is studying the mechanisms of generation of mutations in beta-Covid strains of coronavirus.
